Video evidence: Multiple witnesses, journalists, and news organizations posted videos on social media showing the crowd booing President Trump at the World Series game. These videos serve as a visual confirmation of the claim.
Eyewitness accounts: Reports from various sources, including journalists and spectators, confirm that the crowd reacted negatively towards President Trump. These firsthand accounts add credibility to the claim.
Chants and slogans: Some members of the audience chanted "Lock him up," referencing a popular chant from Trump's 2016 campaign rallies targeting his opponent, Hillary Clinton. This specific chant further supports the authenticity of the claim.
Trump: s reaction: President Trump's surprised expression and subsequent applause, as captured in the video, indicate that he indeed experienced a negative reception from the crowd. His response serves as additional evidence of the claim's authenticity.
